entry.title: Hunter CS and NY Tech - it takes a village
entry.summary:
Figure 1: The NY Tech community and Hunter CS at Yext

One of my goals when I came over to Hunter was to help establish Hunter CS as the place to be for CS in the city before I was done.

Hunter had a solid CS program before I joined but it isn't well known. The school also doesn't have a well defined tech culture which is both a good and bad thing. Hunter's also a commuter school and our students face some challenges that are not as present at private campus based schools.

Maybe it's an overly ambitious goal but if it can be done, what a game changer. A lot of people talk about equity, diversity, and social justice but if we can establish Hunter as the place to be for CS, what a win.

The truth of course is that I can't accomplish this - at least not by myself. I'm just a teacher. Fortunately, there are so many wonderful people in the New York Tech community that want to help bring opportunities to the kids.

Last Thursday evening we got the ball rolling. Twenty five representatives from the tech community got together at Yext with about a dozen of our Hunter College CS students. The conversation started with a discussion of perceptions of Hunter and the student sharing what their experiences were like. By the end we were all brainstorming as to how we can work together to best prepare Hunter students to become members of the New York Tech community.

I know the students left the evening energized and I did as well. I hope our friends in Tech felt the same.

We had representatives from (in alphabetical order)

  • Animoto
  • Beeswax
  • Bloomberg
  • Civic Hall
  • Genacast Ventures
  • Google
  • JW Player
  • Meetup
  • MongoDB
  • Motivate (Citbike)
  • Quentin Road Ventures
  • Twitter
  • Two Sigma
  • Union Square Ventures
  • Workbenc
  • Yext
  • eBay

Some were old friends
